TITLE: Hostage situation in Dresden, Germany, ends with suspect dead and hostages freed
SUMMARY: German police evacuated parts of the eastern city of Dresden on Saturday morning after a man reportedly took two people hostage at a mall.

TITLE: There have been 50,000 alleged war crimes in Ukraine. We worked to solve one
SUMMARY: Investigators in Ukraine have opened more than 50,000 inquiries into alleged Russian war crimes since the war began. NPR looked into the death of one man to show the challenges investigators face.

TITLE: Nearly a million adults became U.S. citizens this past year, a record high since 2008
SUMMARY: Despite the setbacks caused by the pandemic, the federal government naturalized a record number of adult immigrants this year and reduced its application backlog by nearly half.

TITLE: Amid rising energy costs, Italian cooks go old-school to save gas
SUMMARY: In a town in Tuscany, some cooks are moving away from the stove to cook meals in boxes with thick wool lining. These portable ovens use the wool's convection properties as a means of slow cooking.

TITLE: Sinema's break with the Democratic Party may not help her as much as she'd like
SUMMARY: Sen. Kyrsten Sinema announced she will no longer be a member of the Democratic Party, raising questions about how independent politicians can really be.

TITLE: We're not lion: The 2022 Comedy Wildlife Photography Awards are a good laugh
SUMMARY: Jennifer Hadley claimed the top prize for her photo of a 3-month-old lion cub tumbling out of a tree in the Serengeti region of Tanzania.

TITLE: Life in a Ukrainian town: rampaging Russians, power cuts, a visit by Banksy
SUMMARY: Borodianka was largely reduced to rubble by the Russian invasion. It's become a symbol of the devastation inflicted by the Russian forces, and attracted a recent visit by the artist Banksy.

TITLE: Longtime soccer sportswriter Grant Wahl has died covering the World Cup in Qatar
SUMMARY: Grant Wahl was influential in the soccer world. He was able to break down the most intricate of plays and relate to hardcore and casual fans alike.

TITLE: Argentina beats the Netherlands in penalty kicks at the World Cup quarterfinals
SUMMARY: Lionel Messi led Argentina to a quarterfinal victory over the Netherlands in a penalty kick shootout. Messi had a goal, an assist and scored in the shootout. Argentina will take on Croatia next.

TITLE: From president to prisoner: The rapid descent of Peru's Pedro Castillo
SUMMARY: Peru's Pedro Castillo gambled away power in one breathtaking day.

TITLE: More South Korean adoptees who were sent overseas demand probes into their cases
SUMMARY: Nearly 400 South Koreans sent as children to families in the West want an inquiry, saying their adoptions were marred by fake documents that changed child identities or falsely declared them orphans.

TITLE: Croatia stuns top-ranked Brazil to advance to the World Cup semifinals
SUMMARY: Croatia does it again - winning a penalty kick shootout to advance to the semifinals for the second World Cup, eliminating Brazil. Croatia's defense stymied the 5-time champions the entire match.

TITLE: It's thumbs-down in the U.K. for Harry and Meghan's Netflix Series
SUMMARY: Even critics in the liberal media panned <em>Harry & Meghan,

TITLE: Why vaccine hesitancy persists in China — and what they're doing about it
SUMMARY: The reluctance of many citizens — especially the elderly — to get vaccinated is a problem for a government facing intense pressure to roll back strict COVID policies.

TITLE: Here's what Sinema's switch from Democrat to independent could mean for the Senate
SUMMARY: Sinema's move is unlikely to change the power balance in the Senate, as it comes days after Sen. Raphael Warnock won the Georgia runoff election to give Democrats a 51-49 majority.
